pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:0.5: 31. The training rule on lying down on the same bed
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.2: two nuns were lying down on the same bed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.3: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.4: “How can two nuns lie down on the same bed? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.6: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.13: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.14.1: ‘If two nuns lie down on the same bed, they commit an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.4: fully ordained is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.5: If two lie down on the same bed:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.6: if, when one is lying down, the other lies down, they commit an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.7: If both lie down together, they commit an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.8: Every time they get up and then lie down again, they commit an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.2.2: if, when one is lying down, the other sits down;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.2.5: if they are the first offenders.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.2.6: The first training rule is finished.
